intro: Geranium sylvaticum subsp. uralense, commonly known as the Ural geranium, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and Eastern Europe. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. The plant features upright stems with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are pink to purple, with five petals and a distinctive spur, blooming in late summer. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
